## Description {#details}

This file declares a special form of Alias Analysis called <code>Provenance / Analysis&#39;&#39;. </code>

The word provenance&#39;&#39; refers to the history of the ownership / of an object. Thus &#96;‘Provenance Analysis`&#39; is an analysis which attempts to / use various techniques to determine if locally / / WARNING: This file knows about certain library functions. It recognizes them / by name, and hardwires knowledge of their semantics. / / WARNING: This file knows about how certain Objective-C library functions are / used. Naive LLVM IR transformations which would otherwise be / behavior-preserving may break these assumptions.

===-------------------------------------------------------------------—===//

namespace llvm &#123;

class AAResults; class PHINode; class SelectInst; class Value;

namespace objcarc &#123;

/ This is similar to BasicAliasAnalysis, and it uses many of the same / techniques, except it uses special ObjC-specific reasoning about pointer / relationships. / / In this context <code>Provenance&#39;&#39; is defined as the history of an object&#39;s / ownership. Thus </code>Provenance Analysis&#39;&#39; is defined by using the notion of / an &#96;‘independent provenance source`&#39; of a pointer to determine whether or not two pointers have the same provenance source and thus could potentially be related.
